items.content_html:
Back at my Vapor 3 conversion for taphouse.io. I got the leaf errors figured out. üéâ

Next to get my assets linking properly in the Public folder.
The days when I find something to write (even a short journal or microblog post) are days when I feel better. I don‚Äôt know why that is.
I love Ichiro. He‚Äôs probably the only front office guy in baseball who would be out on the field celebrating an extra innings walk off win dresses in full uniform and batting gloves.
I‚Äôm calling it a night. Feeling somewhat defeated by these leaf templates. But I‚Äôll figure it out. Eventually I‚Äôll finish one of these side projects.

I had the site running on Vapor 2 last year. I‚Äôm just trying to update to 3 and the Leaf templating system is throwing errors I didn‚Äôt see before. So I‚Äôve gotta fix those before adapting for Docker. I don‚Äôt expect even full credit at this point.
vapor rum. It could be a long evening. At least the boys upstairs aren‚Äôt screaming anymore.
After 30 minutes of screaming, the boys are in bed, I‚Äôve got an Old Fashioned, and I‚Äôm ready to tackle Vapor 3.

Tonight‚Äôs project after the boys go to bed: Get my taphouse.io site up and running in Vapor 3 on a local Docker container. Extra credit will be given out if I‚Äôm able to also add nginx, and even more credit still if I can get it running on a server. Stay tuned.
Yup. My boys clogged a Froggy Potty.

It‚Äôs getting increasingly common for us to go wake Atticus from nap and find him wearing a shirt for pants, having put his legs through the arms. I wonder if this kid just really wants skinny jeans?!
Thor Ragnarok is an incredibly rewatchable movie. Just so much fun.
Just saw that James Paxton threw a no hitter in Toronto. Way to go Big Maple! Go Mariners!
On the phone with a senior Apple technical support guy and he did screen sharing with my iPhone. Never seen that before, but it‚Äôs pretty cool.
I‚Äôm super sad to learn that Rain Shadow Meats is closing. Our office just moved to Pioneer Square and I was looking forward to getting their wonderful porchetta sandwich from time to time.
I‚Äôm wanting to get into scripting a bit more, and this new trick from Brett Terpstra will be a great way to spin up something new to try out.
New post from jsorge.net: My First Swift Package
Mariners walk off! What a game!

I‚Äôm writing a little thing that will take my markdown files and make them textbundles and want to embed images in the bundle.

Is a regular expression the best way to get any image names from that file?
I just realized I‚Äôve been a 1Password customer for 10 years now. It‚Äôs easily in my pantheon of apps I couldn‚Äôt live without.

Sad day: My Fluid app for GitHub is considered an ‚Äúold browser‚Äù and is starting to break on me. I emailed the developer of Fluid and hope to get a good response, but it hasn‚Äôt been updated in so long that I‚Äôm not optimistic.

Any other good way to silo a web app on the Mac?
Ok, I got the site working locally. Victory! Next would be porting over my Ghost template to Jekyll. That‚Äôs a battle for another day.

I‚Äôm trying to get a Jekyll instance running locally and I keep running into Ruby and Gems issues. I‚Äôve only used Ruby for Cocoapods and the Gems concept is all new to me. Maybe this isn‚Äôt the blog engine for me.
Star Wars in the style of Arrested Development is the video we all need to see today.

Reminder to my future self: setting the delegate property on a UINavigationController subclass doesn‚Äôt always do what I think it will do. In the case of the MFMessageComposeViewController, I needed to set the messageComposeDelegate instead.
New post from jsorge.net: View Controllers Make Crummy Navigators
